verses.verse: Lo, <S%H2005><s%> mine eye <S%H5869><s%> hath seen <S%H7200><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> this, mine ear <S%H241><s%> hath heard <S%H8085><s%> and understood <S%H995><s%> it.
What ye know, <S%H1847><s%> the same do I <S%H589><s%> know <S%H3045><s%> also: <S%H1571><s%> I <S%H595><s%> am not <S%H3808><s%> inferior <S%H5307><s%> unto <S%H4480><s%> you.
Surely <S%H199><s%> I <S%H589><s%> would speak <S%H1696><s%> to <S%H413><s%> the Almighty, <S%H7706><s%> and I desire <S%H2654><s%> to reason <S%H3198><s%> with <S%H413><s%> God. <S%H410><s%>
But <S%H199><s%> ye <S%H859><s%> are forgers <S%H2950><s%> of lies, <S%H8267><s%> ye are all <S%H3605><s%> physicians <S%H7495><s%> of no value. <S%H457><s%>
O that <S%H4130><s%> ye would <S%H5414><s%> altogether hold your peace! <S%H2790><s%> <S%H2790><s%> and it should be <S%H1961><s%> your wisdom. <S%H2451><s%>
Hear <S%H8085><s%> now <S%H4994><s%> my reasoning, <S%H8433><s%> and hearken <S%H7181><s%> to the pleadings <S%H7379><s%> of my lips. <S%H8193><s%>
Will ye speak <S%H1696><s%> wickedly <S%H5766><s%> for God? <S%H410><s%> and talk <S%H1696><s%> deceitfully <S%H7423><s%> for him?
Will ye accept <S%H5375><s%> his person? <S%H6440><s%> will ye contend <S%H7378><s%> for God? <S%H410><s%>

Is it good <S%H2896><s%> that <S%H3588><s%> he should search you out? <S%H2713><s%> <S%H853><s%> or <S%H518><s%> as one man <S%H582><s%> mocketh <S%H2048><s%> another, do ye so mock <S%H2048><s%> him?
He will surely reprove <S%H3198><s%> <S%H3198><s%> you, if <S%H518><s%> ye do secretly <S%H5643><s%> accept <S%H5375><s%> persons. <S%H6440><s%>
Shall not <S%H3808><s%> his excellency <S%H7613><s%> make you afraid? <S%H1204><s%> and his dread <S%H6343><s%> fall <S%H5307><s%> upon <S%H5921><s%> you?
Your remembrances <S%H2146><s%> are like <S%H4912><s%> unto ashes, <S%H665><s%> your bodies <S%H1354><s%> to bodies <S%H1354><s%> of clay. <S%H2563><s%>
Hold your peace, <S%H2790><s%> let me alone, <S%H4480><s%> that I <S%H589><s%> may speak, <S%H1696><s%> and let come <S%H5674><s%> on <S%H5921><s%> me what <S%H4100><s%> will.
Wherefore <S%H5921><s%> <S%H4100><s%> do I take <S%H5375><s%> my flesh <S%H1320><s%> in my teeth, <S%H8127><s%> and put <S%H7760><s%> my life <S%H5315><s%> in mine hand? <S%H3709><s%>
Though <S%H2005><s%> he slay <S%H6991><s%> me, yet will I trust <S%H3176><s%> in him: but <S%H389><s%> I will maintain <S%H3198><s%> mine own ways <S%H1870><s%> before <S%H413><s%> <S%H6440><s%> him.
He <S%H1931><s%> also <S%H1571><s%> shall be my salvation: <S%H3444><s%> for <S%H3588><s%> a hypocrite <S%H2611><s%> shall not <S%H3808><s%> come <S%H935><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> him.
Hear diligently <S%H8085><s%> <S%H8085><s%> my speech, <S%H4405><s%> and my declaration <S%H262><s%> with your ears. <S%H241><s%>
Behold <S%H2009><s%> now, <S%H4994><s%> I have ordered <S%H6186><s%> my cause; <S%H4941><s%> I know <S%H3045><s%> that <S%H3588><s%> I <S%H589><s%> shall be justified. <S%H6663><s%>

Who <S%H4310><s%> is he <S%H1931><s%> that will plead <S%H7378><s%> with <S%H5978><s%> me? for <S%H3588><s%> now, <S%H6258><s%> if I hold my tongue, <S%H2790><s%> I shall give up the ghost. <S%H1478><s%>

Only <S%H389><s%> do <S%H6213><s%> not <S%H408><s%> two <S%H8147><s%> things unto <S%H5978><s%> me: then <S%H227><s%> will I not <S%H3808><s%> hide myself <S%H5641><s%> from <S%H4480><s%> <S%H6440><s%> thee.
Withdraw <S%H7368><s%> thine hand <S%H3709><s%> far from <S%H4480><s%> <S%H5921><s%> me: and let not <S%H408><s%> thy dread <S%H367><s%> make me afraid. <S%H1204><s%>
Then call <S%H7121><s%> thou, and I <S%H595><s%> will answer: <S%H6030><s%> or <S%H176><s%> let me speak, <S%H1696><s%> and answer <S%H7725><s%> thou me.
How <S%H4100><s%> many are mine iniquities <S%H5771><s%> and sins? <S%H2403><s%> make me to know <S%H3045><s%> my transgression <S%H6588><s%> and my sin. <S%H2403><s%>
Wherefore <S%H4100><s%> hidest <S%H5641><s%> thou thy face, <S%H6440><s%> and holdest <S%H2803><s%> me for thine enemy? <S%H341><s%>
Wilt thou break <S%H6206><s%> a leaf <S%H5929><s%> driven to and fro? <S%H5086><s%> and wilt thou pursue <S%H7291><s%> the dry <S%H3002><s%> stubble? <S%H7179><s%>
For <S%H3588><s%> thou writest <S%H3789><s%> bitter things <S%H4846><s%> against <S%H5921><s%> me, and makest me to possess <S%H3423><s%> the iniquities <S%H5771><s%> of my youth. <S%H5271><s%>

Thou puttest <S%H7760><s%> my feet <S%H7272><s%> also in the stocks, <S%H5465><s%> and lookest narrowly <S%H8104><s%> unto all <S%H3605><s%> my paths; <S%H734><s%> thou settest a print <S%H2707><s%> upon <S%H5921><s%> the heels <S%H8328><s%> of my feet. <S%H7272><s%>
And he, <S%H1931><s%> as a rotten thing, <S%H7538><s%> consumeth, <S%H1086><s%> as a garment <S%H899><s%> that is moth <S%H6211><s%> eaten. <S%H398><s%>
